Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

### PR summary [a1f405bda8](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13696/commits/a1f405bda8880fe6574cf1820c248694654d7eb4)

maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by erdOne.
There are significantly more files imported in some files. Does it make sense to put the new material in a separate file?

> There are significantly more files imported in some files. Does it make sense to put the new material in a separate file?

I made a new file.

LGTM

bors merge
Thanks for the reviews!

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9480690481/job/26121913676)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9480690481/job/26121914522)

This should be called `algebraTensorAlgEquiv_tmul_X`, and I think we should have `algebraTensorAlgEquiv_tmul` as the simp lemma (`algebraTensorAlgEquiv (R := R) A (a âŠ—â‚œ p) = a â€¢ p.map (algebraMap R A)`)
Should I keep the `tmul_X` version? With the new lemma it is proven by `simp`.
Hmmm maybe not. Sometimes it still useful to restate lemma provable by simp for rewriting, but this lemma is merely two rewrites.
Similarly this should be called `algebraTensorAlgEquiv_symm_X`. Should there be a `algebraTensorAlgEquiv_symm_monomial`? Would it be useful?
I added `algebraTensorAlgEquiv_symm_monomial`.
This could be an instance.
Is the `(R := R)` necessary here? If it is, I don't see how it could be implicit elsewhere and I'd suggest we make it explicit in the first place.
In this example it is indeed not necessary, in the `symm_X` lemma below it is necessary though. Should I make it explicit anyway?
In that case I think we should make it explicit.
Done.

Apparently this already [exists](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/12293/files#diff-fcd41314736c9eb63afb8cedfaae8800b725b0f3003d437246bf1c6caf4b3f81R185-R186) thanks to @AntoineChambert-Loir

I thought so as well, but I don't think that is entirely correct. First, in the equiv you cited `N` is just a module, so the equiv is only `R`-linear but I need `A`-linearity. Secondly, even if you ask `N` to be an `R`-algebra, the LHS in the equiv you cited is "the wrong way" round for my application: I think @AntoineChambert-Loir had in mind to enhance it to something `MvPolynomial Ïƒ R`-linear for which `MvPolynomial Ïƒ R` has to be on the left of the `âŠ—[R]`. But I need it to be `A`-linear, so `A` has to be on the left of `âŠ—[R]`.

And while I can probably massage `scalarRTensorAlgEquiv` into the thing I want by using `Algebra.TensorProduct.comm` and promoting it to an `A`-linear map, I think this would be longer and would have worse definitional properties than the direct definition.

`N` is a CommSemiring there (that's a prerequisite for MvPolynomial), but yes I neglected the A-linearity, which requires A on the left. I'm fine with you keeping your construction (if Antoine has no better suggestion). Can you please generalize from Ring to Semiring though?
Done
Thanks, LGTM!
Why aren't you adding a `StableUnderBaseChange @FinitePresentation` theorem?
Because the file `RingHom/FinitePresentation.lean` does not yet exist. I am happy to follow-up on that though with another PR.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory): finite type and finite presentation are stable under base change
